channel.title: Is anyone interested in using multiple DVM Templates based on whonix-ws-14?
channel.description:
Is anyone interested in using multiple DVM Templates based on whonix-ws-14? What's your use case?
Or as far as multiple DVM Templates are concerned, is everyone only interested in different DVMs based on different templates such as having a single DVM Template based on whonix-ws-14 and another one on debian-9 or so?
I am asking since https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Qubes/Disposable_VM may or may not include instructions on how to archive that.
//cc @tatertot

item.title: Is anyone interested in using multiple DVM Templates based on whonix-ws-14?
item.dc:creator: 9jnc7
item.description:
Patrick:

What’s your use case?

I like to have a DVM that forces onion for certain sites to avoid exit nodes, and a regular DVM for browsing everything else.

Read full topic
item.source: Is anyone interested in using multiple DVM Templates based on whonix-ws-14?

item.source: Is anyone interested in using multiple DVM Templates based on whonix-ws-14?

item.title: Is anyone interested in using multiple DVM Templates based on whonix-ws-14?
item.dc:creator: tatertot
item.description:
Currently use 2:

  • the factory-default DVM template
  • for less secure browsing, a faster / more comfortable DVM template containing quantum-based torbrowser with ublock origin and night mode.

Read full topic
item.source: Is anyone interested in using multiple DVM Templates based on whonix-ws-14?

item.title: Is anyone interested in using multiple DVM Templates based on whonix-ws-14?
item.dc:creator: 0brand
item.description:
Patrick:

Is anyone interested in using multiple DVM Templates based on whonix-ws-14? What’s your use case?

Yes,

  • Using DVM Templates based on whonix-ws TemplateVMs that use testing (buster) and unstable (sid) repositories.
  • Using different Tor Browser profiles in each DVM Template.

.

Read full topic
item.source: Is anyone interested in using multiple DVM Templates based on whonix-ws-14?
